# insufficientVerticalSweep

**Type Property**

Indicates that the device needs more vertical motion.

## Declaration

```swift
static let insufficientVerticalSweep: NIAlgorithmConvergenceStatus.Reason
```

## Discussion

Coach the user to resolve the issue, such as by presenting text that asks the user to move the device in a vertical direction.

This reason may prevent a nearby object from providing a [doc://com.apple.nearbyinteraction/documentation/NearbyInteraction/NINearbyObject/verticalDirectionEstimate-swift.property]. This reason doesn’t effect the [doc://com.apple.nearbyinteraction/documentation/NearbyInteraction/NINearbyObject/horizontalAngle-hsg] property.

## Interpreting the convergence status reason

- **insufficientMovement**: Indicates that the device needs to move from its current position in the physical environment.
- **insufficientHorizontalSweep**: Indicates that the device needs more horizontal motion.
- **insufficientLighting**: Indicates that the camera needs to view the physical environment under better lighting conditions.
- **insufficientSignalStrength**: Indicates that the users might be too far apart.
